page.title: 11COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: In Tyringham cum Filgrave the main links and most used are the telephone and car. only two houses are without a phone so great was the need for a telephone service that in 1937 the people of the village of Filgrave paid for their own box to be installed outside the school when the Post Office claimed not enough use would be made of one.Every family has use of a car sometime during the day.many are 2 car families or even more as people with jobs cannot get to them without one.the only public transport being on a wednesday in term time only,to NORTHAMPTON at 9:30am returning to the village at 3pm and on a Saterday to MILTON KEYNES AT 10:30 RETURNING at 1:00pm and on a thursday a minibus run by the community services and paid for by the borough council, parish council & passengers goes to olney for shopping
